description:
'''Wally Gagel''' is an American [[record producer]], audio engineer, mixer, multi-instrumentalist and songwriter. 

Credits include: [[Family of the Year]], [[Elliphant]], [[Blondfire]], [[Zella Day]], [[Best Coast]], [[Cold War Kids]], [[Miley Cyrus]], [[Billie Eilish]], [[New Order (band)|New Order]], [[Muse (band)|Muse]], [[The Rolling Stones|Rolling Stones]], [[Britney Spears]], [[Jessica Simpson]], [[Rihanna]], [[Redlight King]], [[Eels (band)|Eels]], [[Robert DeLong]] and in collaboration with iTunes Sessions: [[Bon Iver]], [[Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros]], [[Gorillaz]], [[The Gaslight Anthem]], [[Lykke Li]], [[Vampire Weekend]], [[Black Rebel Motorcycle Club]], [[PJ Harvey]], [[Metric (band)|Metric]], [[The Decemberists]], [[Norah Jones]], and more. His production of [[Family of the Year]]'s single "Hero" caught the attention of movie director Richard Linklater who used it in the film "Boyhood."

In 2006 he formed the production partnership [[Wax Ltd|WAX LTD]] with songwriter and producer, [[Xandy Barry]] and in 2019 they formed a joint venture with Universal Music Production Group called AUDIO WAX.
